intro: Pleroma orbignyanum, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a syncarpous, fleshy structure that contains multiple seeds. Pleroma orbignyanum is often found growing in rocky or dry habitats, demonstrating adaptability to harsh environments.
